content.description: The plumb line on this face. A little bit of loose rock takes away from the quality but this is still a line that screams to be climbed.
content.location: Climb down into the pit and SDS in the center of the boulder using a rounded sidepull pocket for the LH and a shallow pocket for the RH. Do a hard deadpoint up to an incut sidepull with the LH then continue straight up. *The chunk of rock at about the 8' level looks enticing but was not used on the first ascent due to its apparently sketchy attachment to the wall.

content.description: This is THE boulder to climb here, as far as aesthetics go. Located in the depths of the streambed, the overhanging pocketed face of this block is the most impressive looking line in the canyon.
